title: Live updates: Israel says it is carrying out strikes on military targets in Iran; blasts heard in Tehran
content: The Israel Defense Forces announced the operation, saying it was in response to “continuous attacks” from Iran.
summary: The Israel Defense Forces announced the operation, saying it was in response to “continuous attacks” from Iran.

content: The upcoming talks in Qatar represent the latest effort by the United States to forge a cease-fire after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
summary: The upcoming talks in Qatar represent the latest effort by the United States to forge a cease-fire after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.

title: Sole operating hospital in northern Gaza ‘under siege,’ WHO says
Israeli forces kill 3 journalists in Lebanon, raid hospital in north Gaza
content: The top U.N. human rights official said Friday that the “darkest moment of the conflict in Gaza is unfolding in the north.”
summary: The top U.N. human rights official said Friday that the “darkest moment of the conflict in Gaza is unfolding in the north.”

title: Israeli strike in south Lebanon kills three journalists, government says
U.S. push for political reform in Lebanon collides with harsh realities
content: An American call for a new Lebanese president has highlighted the country’s fractious, fragile politics and Hezbollah’s entrenched position.
summary: An American call for a new Lebanese president has highlighted the country’s fractious, fragile politics and Hezbollah’s entrenched position.

title: A medieval saga told of a man thrown in a well. Scientists found him.
content: A team of researchers found the remains of the “Well-man” from an 800-year-old Norse saga and used ancient DNA analysis to reconstruct who he was.
summary: A team of researchers found the remains of the “Well-man” from an 800-year-old Norse saga and used ancient DNA analysis to reconstruct who he was.

title: Ukrainian incursion in Kursk struggles as Russians retake territory
content: The recent Russian counterattacks in Kursk have retaken up to half of the territory first seized, casting doubt on how long Kyiv will be able to continue holding it.
summary: The recent Russian counterattacks in Kursk have retaken up to half of the territory first seized, casting doubt on how long Kyiv will be able to continue holding it.

title: Do you know where Trump and Harris stand on foreign policy? Take our quiz.
content: Find out how Trump and Harris plan to address international issues such as immigration, the Middle East and Ukraine.
summary: Find out how Trump and Harris plan to address international issues such as immigration, the Middle East and Ukraine.

title: China and Iran champion close ties, but Beijing’s influence is limited
content: An Israeli strike on Iran could upset China’s oil supplies, but Beijing is more interested in looking like a peacemaker than actually making peace, analysts say.
summary: An Israeli strike on Iran could upset China’s oil supplies, but Beijing is more interested in looking like a peacemaker than actually making peace, analysts say.

title: Hezbollah proving a formidable foe against Israeli forces in Lebanon
Satellite images show major expansion at Russian site with secret bioweapons past
content: New construction at a military research site near Moscow reveals a specialized laboratory complex designed to research and handle deadly pathogens, experts say.
summary: New construction at a military research site near Moscow reveals a specialized laboratory complex designed to research and handle deadly pathogens, experts say.

title: Lies, intrigue, lawsuits: The last battle for a ‘cursed’ giant emerald
content: The Bahia Emerald, a minifridge-sized mass of black schist and green crystals, might be worth $1 billion. Brazil wants it back.
summary: The Bahia Emerald, a minifridge-sized mass of black schist and green crystals, might be worth $1 billion. Brazil wants it back.

Is Israel carrying out de facto ethnic cleansing?
content: A pro-settlement Israeli group and some Israeli lawmakers gathered a couple miles from northern Gaza’s blasted neighborhoods to rally around settling Gaza.
summary: A pro-settlement Israeli group and some Israeli lawmakers gathered a couple miles from northern Gaza’s blasted neighborhoods to rally around settling Gaza.

title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
content: The Israeli military published documents that it said showed cooperation between Al Jazeera and Hamas. The network denied the allegations, saying Israel wanted to “silence” its journalists.
summary: The Israeli military published documents that it said showed cooperation between Al Jazeera and Hamas. The network denied the allegations, saying Israel wanted to “silence” its journalists.

title: Why North Korea is sending soldiers to the Russian front lines
content: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.
summary: South Korea has urged Russia to take “immediate” action to withdraw North Korean troops, as Kim Jong Un seeks to strengthen the alliance between Moscow and Pyongyang.

title: People in northern Gaza running out of means to survive, U.N. says
content: Israel’s military assault has pushed the area to the edge of humanitarian collapse, aid officials say, after a near-total blockade on aid deliveries to the north.
summary: Israel’s military assault has pushed the area to the edge of humanitarian collapse, aid officials say, after a near-total blockade on aid deliveries to the north.

title: Putin does not deny presence of North Korean troops in Russia
content: The U.S. government said it had evidence that at least 3,000 North Korean soldiers were being trained in Russia.
summary: The U.S. government said it had evidence that at least 3,000 North Korean soldiers were being trained in Russia.

title: Canada to cut immigration levels in major reversal, Trudeau says
content: The U-turn, on an approach that has set Canada apart from the United States, comes as public support for immigration wanes.
summary: The U-turn, on an approach that has set Canada apart from the United States, comes as public support for immigration wanes.

U.S. announces plan to resume Gaza peace talks, send $135M in aid for Palestinians
content: U.S. and Israeli officials are set for talks in Doha on a cease-fire and hostage deal, the U.S. secretary of state said. He announced $135 million in aid for Palestinians.
summary: U.S. and Israeli officials are set for talks in Doha on a cease-fire and hostage deal, the U.S. secretary of state said. He announced $135 million in aid for Palestinians.

title: Mapped: Sites in Iran that Israel could strike
content: Iran is bracing for a retaliatory attack by Israel, which analysts say will probably target military sites rather than nuclear or oil facilities.
summary: Iran is bracing for a retaliatory attack by Israel, which analysts say will probably target military sites rather than nuclear or oil facilities.

title: Putin presents himself as champion of the developing world at summit
content: Russia was in the spotlight at the BRICS summit, but the organization of mostly developing nations is far from united behind Vladimir Putin’s agenda.
summary: Russia was in the spotlight at the BRICS summit, but the organization of mostly developing nations is far from united behind Vladimir Putin’s agenda.

title: Israel, U.S. announce efforts to negotiate cease-fire and hostage deal
Hezbollah proving a formidable foe against Israeli forces in Lebanon
content: The militant group has bounced back from major setbacks thanks to a flexible command structure, help from Iran and years of planning for an Israeli invasion.
summary: The militant group has bounced back from major setbacks thanks to a flexible command structure, help from Iran and years of planning for an Israeli invasion.

title: North Gaza faces ‘extraordinary challenges,’ Blinken says, as conditions worsen
36-year-old surfer dies after being impaled by sharp-billed fish
content: Italian surfer Giulia Manfrini was surfing in the Mentawai Islands when she was impaled by a swordfish, Indonesian authorities said. The resort said it was a needlefish.
summary: Italian surfer Giulia Manfrini was surfing in the Mentawai Islands when she was impaled by a swordfish, Indonesian authorities said. The resort said it was a needlefish.

title: Buildings destroyed as Israel continues to hit Beirut with airstrikes

content: Democrats and Republicans are urging U.S. citizens in far-flung areas — from Toronto to Tel Aviv — to cast absentee ballots.
summary: Democrats and Republicans are urging U.S. citizens in far-flung areas — from Toronto to Tel Aviv — to cast absentee ballots.

title: Sword with pharaoh’s mark found in Egypt, still shimmering 3,000 years later
content: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.
summary: The bronze sword was unearthed by archaeologists at an ancient fort in the Nile Delta. It was emblazoned with the signature emblem of Ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramses II.

title: American views of China hit record low, poll finds, as animosity grows
content: A majority of Americans — 55 percent — say the United States should actively work to limit the growth of China’s power, according to a Chicago Council poll.
summary: A majority of Americans — 55 percent — say the United States should actively work to limit the growth of China’s power, according to a Chicago Council poll.

title: Al Jazeera condemns Israeli claim that its journalists have militant links
Israeli attacks on Hezbollah financing show group’s reach in Lebanon

content: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting the Middle East. Israeli forces said they killed Hashem Safieddine, a top Hezbollah leader.
summary: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting the Middle East. Israeli forces said they killed Hashem Safieddine, a top Hezbollah leader.
